task.title: Implement agent health monitoring with PID tracking and crash detection

events.content: Used existing memory monitor from resiliency package for RSS/CPU tracking: Used existing memory monitor from resiliency package for RSS/CPU tracking

raw.question: Used existing memory monitor from resiliency package for RSS/CPU tracking
raw.chosen: Used existing memory monitor from resiliency package for RSS/CPU tracking
raw.reasoning: Avoids duplication, already has trend analysis and alert thresholds

events.content: Implemented 'releasing' flag pattern to distinguish graceful stops from crashes: Implemented 'releasing' flag pattern to distinguish graceful stops from crashes

raw.question: Implemented 'releasing' flag pattern to distinguish graceful stops from crashes
raw.chosen: Implemented 'releasing' flag pattern to distinguish graceful stops from crashes
raw.reasoning: Prevents false crash announcements when agents are intentionally stopped

events.content: Collect crashed agents then handle outside iteration to prevent race conditions: Collect crashed agents then handle outside iteration to prevent race conditions

raw.question: Collect crashed agents then handle outside iteration to prevent race conditions
raw.chosen: Collect crashed agents then handle outside iteration to prevent race conditions
raw.reasoning: Modifying Map during iteration causes undefined behavior; collecting first ensures consistent state

retrospective.summary: Added comprehensive agent health monitoring to orchestrator: PID heartbeat checks (10s), memory/CPU tracking via resiliency package, crash detection with broadcast to other agents, graceful release handling, and resource alerts. Fixed race conditions, memory leaks, and added 14 unit tests.
